almost.functional.utils
Class Iterators

Utility class for Iterators.

Method Detail

next

public static <T> java.util.Iterator<T> next(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> iterator,
                                             int count)
This returns an Iterator limited to no more then the next count elements. The original iterator is advanced by the calls to next on the returned iterator.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type.
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator to draw elements from.
count - the maximum number of elements to draw.
Returns:
An iterator.
Since:
1.9.3

collect

public static <T> java.util.List<T> collect(java.util.Iterator<T> iterator)
Collect an iterator's elements into a List.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator
Returns:
a List containing the elements
Since:
1.9.3

parallelBatch

public static <T> void parallelBatch(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> iterator,
                                     Consumer<java.util.Iterator<? extends T>> consumer,
                                     int batchSize)
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                 java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
Break an iterator's elements into batches, and invoke the consumer on these batches in a thread pool.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator to draw elements from
consumer - the Consumer to use the batches
batchSize - the maximum number of elements per batch
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
Since:
1.9.3

concat

public static <T> java.util.Iterator<T> concat(java.util.Iterator<? extends T>... iterators)
Create an iterator which sequentially iterates over a collection of iterators.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
iterators - the iterators to iterate
Returns:
the new iterator
